elf_header.description: The ELF header is described by the type Elf32_Ehdr or Elf64_Ehdr

e_ident.description: This array of bytes specifies how to interpret the file, independent of the processor or the file's remaining contents.

macros.EI_MAG0: The first byte of the magic number. It must be filled with ELFMAG0. (0: 0x7f)
macros.EI_MAG1: The second byte of the magic number. It must be filled with ELFMAG1. (1: 'E')
macros.EI_MAG2: The third byte of the magic number. It must be filled with ELFMAG2. (2: 'L')
macros.EI_MAG3: The fourth byte of the magic number. It must be filled with ELFMAG3. (3: 'F')

EI_CLASS.description: The fifth byte identifies the architecture for this binary
EI_CLASS.ELFCLASS32: This defines the 32-bit architecture. It supports machines with files and virtual address spaces up to 4 Gigabytes.

EI_DATA.description: The sixth byte specifies the data encoding of the processor-specific data in the file.

EI_VERSION.description: The seventh byte is the version number of the ELF specification

EI_OSABI.description: The eighth byte identifies the operating system and ABI to which the object is targeted.

macros.EI_ABIVERSION: The ninth byte identifies the version of the ABI to which the object is targeted.
macros.EI_PAD: Start of padding. These bytes are reserved and set to zero.
macros.EI_NIDENT: The size of the e_ident array.

e_type.description: This member of the structure identifies the object file type

e_machine.description: This member specifies the required architecture for an individual file.

e_version.description: This member identifies the file version

fields.e_entry: This member gives the virtual address to which the system first transfers control, thus starting the process.
fields.e_phoff: This member holds the program header table's file offset in bytes.
fields.e_shoff: This member holds the section header table's file offset in bytes.
fields.e_flags: This member holds processor-specific flags associated with the file.
fields.e_ehsize: This member holds the ELF header's size in bytes.
fields.e_phentsize: This member holds the size in bytes of one entry in the file's program header table.
fields.e_phnum: This member holds the number of entries in the program header table.
fields.e_shentsize: This member holds a sections header's size in bytes.
fields.e_shnum: This member holds the number of entries in the section header table.
fields.e_shstrndx: This member holds the section header table index of the entry associated with the section name string table.

p_type.description: This member of the structure indicates what kind of segment this array element describes
p_type.PT_NULL: The array element is unused and the other members' values are undefined.
p_type.PT_LOAD: The array element specifies a loadable segment, described by p_filesz and p_memsz.
p_type.PT_DYNAMIC: The array element specifies dynamic linking information.
p_type.PT_INTERP: The array element specifies the location and size of a null-terminated pathname to invoke as an interpreter.
p_type.PT_NOTE: The array element specifies the location of notes (ElfN_Nhdr).
p_type.PT_SHLIB: This segment type is reserved but has unspecified semantics.
p_type.PT_PHDR: The array element, if present, specifies the location and size of the program header table itself.
p_type.PT_LOPROC: Values in the inclusive range [PT_LOPROC, PT_HIPROC] are reserved for processor-specific semantics.
p_type.PT_HIPROC: Values in the inclusive range [PT_LOPROC, PT_HIPROC] are reserved for processor-specific semantics.
p_type.PT_GNU_STACK: GNU extension which is used by the Linux kernel to control the state of the stack via the flags set in the p_flags member.

fields.p_offset: This member holds the offset from the beginning of the file at which the first byte of the segment resides.
fields.p_vaddr: This member holds the virtual address at which the first byte of the segment resides in memory.
fields.p_paddr: On systems for which physical addressing is relevant, this member is reserved for the segment's physical address.
fields.p_filesz: This member holds the number of bytes in the file image of the segment. It may be zero.
fields.p_memsz: This member holds the number of bytes in the memory image of the segment. It may be zero.

p_flags.description: This member holds a bit mask of flags relevant to the segment

fields.p_align: This member holds the value to which the segments are aligned in memory and in the file.

reserved_indices.SHN_UNDEF: This value marks an undefined, missing, irrelevant, or otherwise meaningless section reference.
reserved_indices.SHN_LORESERVE: This value specifies the lower bound of the range of reserved indices.
reserved_indices.SHN_LOPROC: Values in the inclusive range [SHN_LOPROC, SHN_HIPROC] are reserved for processor-specific semantics.
reserved_indices.SHN_HIPROC: Values in the inclusive range [SHN_LOPROC, SHN_HIPROC] are reserved for processor-specific semantics.
reserved_indices.SHN_ABS: This value specifies the absolute value for the corresponding reference.
reserved_indices.SHN_COMMON: Symbols defined relative to this section are common symbols.
reserved_indices.SHN_HIRESERVE: This value specifies the upper bound of the range of reserved indices.

fields.sh_name: This member specifies the name of the section.

sh_type.description: This member categorizes the section's contents and semantics
sh_type.SHT_NULL: This value marks the section header as inactive.
sh_type.SHT_PROGBITS: This section holds information defined by the program.
sh_type.SHT_SYMTAB: This section holds a symbol table.
sh_type.SHT_STRTAB: This section holds a string table.
sh_type.SHT_RELA: This section holds relocation entries with explicit addends.
sh_type.SHT_HASH: This section holds a symbol hash table.
sh_type.SHT_DYNAMIC: This section holds information for dynamic linking.
sh_type.SHT_NOBITS: A section of this type occupies no space in the file but otherwise resembles SHT_PROGBITS.
sh_type.SHT_REL: This section holds relocation offsets without explicit addends.
sh_type.SHT_SHLIB: This section is reserved but has unspecified semantics.
sh_type.SHT_DYNSYM: This section holds a minimal set of dynamic linking symbols.
sh_type.SHT_LOPROC: Values in the inclusive range [SHT_LOPROC, SHT_HIPROC] are reserved for processor-specific semantics.
sh_type.SHT_HIPROC: Values in the inclusive range [SHT_LOPROC, SHT_HIPROC] are reserved for processor-specific semantics.
sh_type.SHT_LOUSER: This value specifies the lower bound of the range of indices reserved for application programs.
sh_type.SHT_HIUSER: This value specifies the upper bound of the range of indices reserved for application programs.

sh_flags.description: Sections support one-bit flags that describe miscellaneous attributes
sh_flags.SHF_WRITE: This section contains data that should be writable during process execution.
sh_flags.SHF_ALLOC: This section occupies memory during process execution.
sh_flags.SHF_EXECINSTR: This section contains executable machine instructions.
sh_flags.SHF_MASKPROC: All bits included in this mask are reserved for processor-specific semantics.

fields.sh_addr: If this section appears in the memory image of a process, this member holds the address at which the section's first byte should reside.
fields.sh_offset: This member's value holds the byte offset from the beginning of the file to the first byte in the section.
fields.sh_size: This member holds the section's size in bytes.
fields.sh_link: This member holds a section header table index link, whose interpretation depends on the section type.
fields.sh_info: This member holds extra information, whose interpretation depends on the section type.
fields.sh_addralign: Some sections have address alignment constraints.
fields.sh_entsize: Some sections hold a table of fixed-sized entries, such as a symbol table.

special_sections..bss: This section holds uninitialized data that contributes to the program's memory image. Type: SHT_NOBITS. Attributes: SHF_ALLOC, SHF_WRITE.
special_sections..comment: This section holds version control information. Type: SHT_PROGBITS.
special_sections..ctors: This section holds initialized pointers to the C++ constructor functions. Type: SHT_PROGBITS. Attributes: SHF_ALLOC, SHF_WRITE.
special_sections..data: This section holds initialized data that contribute to the program's memory image. Type: SHT_PROGBITS. Attributes: SHF_ALLOC, SHF_WRITE.
special_sections..data1: This section holds initialized data that contribute to the program's memory image. Type: SHT_PROGBITS. Attributes: SHF_ALLOC, SHF_WRITE.
special_sections..debug: This section holds information for symbolic debugging. Type: SHT_PROGBITS.
special_sections..dtors: This section holds initialized pointers to the C++ destructor functions. Type: SHT_PROGBITS. Attributes: SHF_ALLOC, SHF_WRITE.
special_sections..dynamic: This section holds dynamic linking information. Type: SHT_DYNAMIC. Attributes: SHF_ALLOC.
special_sections..dynstr: This section holds strings needed for dynamic linking. Type: SHT_STRTAB. Attributes: SHF_ALLOC.
special_sections..dynsym: This section holds the dynamic linking symbol table. Type: SHT_DYNSYM. Attributes: SHF_ALLOC.
special_sections..fini: This section holds executable instructions that contribute to the process termination code. Type: SHT_PROGBITS. Attributes: SHF_ALLOC, SHF_EXECINSTR.
special_sections..gnu.version: This section holds the version symbol table. Type: SHT_GNU_versym. Attributes: SHF_ALLOC.
special_sections..gnu.version_d: This section holds the version symbol definitions. Type: SHT_GNU_verdef. Attributes: SHF_ALLOC.
special_sections..gnu.version_r: This section holds the version symbol needed elements. Type: SHT_GNU_versym. Attributes: SHF_ALLOC.
special_sections..got: This section holds the global offset table. Type: SHT_PROGBITS.
special_sections..hash: This section holds a symbol hash table. Type: SHT_HASH. Attributes: SHF_ALLOC.
special_sections..init: This section holds executable instructions that contribute to the process initialization code. Type: SHT_PROGBITS. Attributes: SHF_ALLOC, SHF_EXECINSTR.
special_sections..interp: This section holds the pathname of a program interpreter. Type: SHT_PROGBITS.
special_sections..line: This section holds line number information for symbolic debugging. Type: SHT_PROGBITS.
special_sections..note: This section holds various notes. Type: SHT_NOTE.
special_sections..note.ABI-tag: This section is used to declare the expected run-time ABI of the ELF image. Type: SHT_NOTE. Attributes: SHF_ALLOC.
special_sections..note.gnu.build-id: This section is used to hold an ID that uniquely identifies the contents of the ELF image. Type: SHT_NOTE. Attributes: SHF_ALLOC.
special_sections..note.GNU-stack: This section is used in Linux object files for declaring stack attributes. Type: SHT_PROGBITS. Attributes: SHF_EXECINSTR.
special_sections..note.openbsd.ident: OpenBSD native executables usually contain this section to identify themselves. Type: SHT_NOTE.
special_sections..plt: This section holds the procedure linkage table. Type: SHT_PROGBITS.
special_sections..rel.NAME: This section holds relocation information (without addend). Type: SHT_REL.
special_sections..rela.NAME: This section holds relocation information (with addend). Type: SHT_RELA.
special_sections..rodata: This section holds read-only data that typically contributes to a nonwritable segment. Type: SHT_PROGBITS. Attributes: SHF_ALLOC.
special_sections..rodata1: This section holds read-only data that typically contributes to a nonwritable segment. Type: SHT_PROGBITS. Attributes: SHF_ALLOC.
special_sections..shstrtab: This section holds section names. Type: SHT_STRTAB.
special_sections..strtab: This section holds strings, most commonly the strings that represent the names associated with symbol table entries. Type: SHT_STRTAB.
special_sections..symtab: This section holds a symbol table. Type: SHT_SYMTAB.
special_sections..text: This section holds the executable instructions of a program. Type: SHT_PROGBITS. Attributes: SHF_ALLOC, SHF_EXECINSTR.

type.STT_NOTYPE: The symbol's type is not defined.
type.STT_OBJECT: The symbol is associated with a data object.
type.STT_FUNC: The symbol is associated with a function or other executable code.
type.STT_SECTION: The symbol is associated with a section.
type.STT_FILE: By convention, the symbol's name gives the name of the source file associated with the object file.
type.STT_LOPROC: Values in the inclusive range [STT_LOPROC, STT_HIPROC] are reserved for processor-specific semantics.
type.STT_HIPROC: Values in the inclusive range [STT_LOPROC, STT_HIPROC] are reserved for processor-specific semantics.

binding.STB_LOCAL: Local symbols are not visible outside the object file containing their definition.
binding.STB_GLOBAL: Global symbols are visible to all object files being combined.
binding.STB_WEAK: Weak symbols resemble global symbols, but their definitions have lower precedence.
binding.STB_LOPROC: Values in the inclusive range [STB_LOPROC, STB_HIPROC] are reserved for processor-specific semantics.
binding.STB_HIPROC: Values in the inclusive range [STB_LOPROC, STB_HIPROC] are reserved for processor-specific semantics.

visibility.STV_HIDDEN: Symbol is unavailable to other modules.
visibility.STV_PROTECTED: Symbol is available to other modules, but references in the local module always resolve to the local symbol.

fields.r_offset: This member gives the location at which to apply the relocation action.
fields.r_info: This member gives both the symbol table index with respect to which the relocation must be made and the type of relocation to apply.
fields.r_addend: This member specifies a constant addend used to compute the value to be stored into the relocatable field.

dynamic_tags.description: Dynamic tags (Dyn) - The .dynamic section contains a series of structures that hold relevant dynamic linking information

tags.DT_NEEDED: String table offset to name of a needed library
tags.DT_PLTRELSZ: Size in bytes of PLT relocation entries
tags.DT_RELASZ: Size in bytes of the Rela relocation table
tags.DT_RELAENT: Size in bytes of a Rela relocation table entry
tags.DT_STRSZ: Size in bytes of string table
tags.DT_SYMENT: Size in bytes of a symbol table entry
tags.DT_SONAME: String table offset to name of shared object
tags.DT_RPATH: String table offset to search path for direct and indirect library dependencies
tags.DT_SYMBOLIC: Alert linker to search this shared object before the executable for symbols
tags.DT_RELSZ: Size in bytes of Rel relocation table
tags.DT_RELENT: Size in bytes of a Rel table entry
tags.DT_PLTREL: Type of relocation entry to which the PLT refers (Rela or Rel)
tags.DT_TEXTREL: Absence of this entry indicates that no relocation entries should apply to a nonwritable segment
tags.DT_JMPREL: Address of relocation entries associated solely with the PLT
tags.DT_BIND_NOW: Instruct dynamic linker to process all relocations before transferring control to the executable
tags.DT_RUNPATH: String table offset to search path for direct library dependencies
tags.DT_LOPROC: Values in the inclusive range [DT_LOPROC, DT_HIPROC] are reserved for processor-specific semantics
tags.DT_HIPROC: Values in the inclusive range [DT_LOPROC, DT_HIPROC] are reserved for processor-specific semantics

notes.description: Notes (Nhdr) - ELF notes allow for appending arbitrary information for the system to use. They are largely used by core files (e_type of ET_CORE), but many projects define their own set of extensions.

fields.n_namesz: The length of the name field in bytes. The contents will immediately follow this note in memory. The name is null terminated. For example, if the name is 'GNU', then n_namesz will be set to 4.
fields.n_descsz: The length of the descriptor field in bytes. The contents will immediately follow the name field in memory.
fields.n_type: Depending on the value of the name field, this member may have various values as defined below.

core_file_notes.description: Notes used by core files (e_type = ET_CORE). These are highly operating system or architecture specific and often require close coordination with kernels, C libraries, and debuggers.

gnu_extensions.description: Extensions used by the GNU tool chain (n_name = GNU)

NT_GNU_ABI_TAG.description: Operating system (OS) ABI information. The desc field contains 4 words

details.[0]: OS descriptor (ELF_NOTE_OS_LINUX, ELF_NOTE_OS_GNU, and so on)

NT_GNU_HWCAP.description: Synthetic hwcap information. The desc field begins with two words

details.note: Then follow variable-length entries, one byte followed by a null-terminated hwcap name string

gnu_extensions.NT_GNU_BUILD_ID: Unique build ID as generated by the GNU ld(1) --build-id option. The desc consists of any nonzero number of bytes.
gnu_extensions.NT_GNU_GOLD_VERSION: The desc contains the GNU Gold linker version used.

default_unknown_namespace.description: Default/unknown namespace notes (e_type != ET_CORE). These are used when the namespace is the default (i.e., n_namesz will be set to 0), or a fallback when the namespace is unknown.
default_unknown_namespace.NT_VERSION: A version string of some sort.
